title: Dog walker, 68, is charged with beating a nine-year-old boy unconscious in retaliation for snowball
text:
A 68-year-old dog walker has been accused of knocking a nine-year-old boy unconscious after he says the child threw a snowball at him.

Gordon Van Hassel, of Douglas, North Dakota, was walking his dog on Friday when he says he was struck by a snow while walking past a group of boys having a snowball fight.

The victim claims that Van Hassel then rounded on them, throwing stones and yelling obscenities at the children before rushing towards the boy.

Gordon Van Hassel, of Douglas, North Dakota, was walking his dog on Friday when he says he was struck by a snow while walking past a group of boys having a snowball fight

Van Hassel shoved him into a truck, knocked him to the ground and then repeatedly kicked him and whacked his head against the ground, according to the victim's affidavit.

The youngster had to be dragged on a sled to a nearby house where his grandfather was looking after him, according to KFYR-TV.

The relative took the nine-year-old to the Trinity Hospital ER in Minot where he was found to have fluid in his abdomen and injuries and swelling to his head.

Van Hassel is being detained at the Ward County Jail (pictured)

When officers arrived at Van Hassel's home they asked why he thought they were there, and he replied: 'For beating up that kid.'

Van Hassel was expected to appear in court Tuesday to be arraigned for aggravated assault of a victim under 12, which carries a maximum of ten years in jail.

He is being detained at the Ward County Jail, according to the Grand Forks Herald.
